cyclone.name: HENRI
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move west tonight, then curve northwest Friday and northward toward the waters offshore of the Mid-Atlantic and southern New England this weekend, remaining over the Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: None – center forecast to stay offshore of the U.S. East Coast through day-5
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: 0 (system is already well offshore of Philadelphia Regional Port, PA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect only for Bermuda
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Outer waters from the Carolinas northward to southern New England likely to experience swells and gusty winds as Henri moves northward offshore
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤3%) of sustained 34-kt winds; occasional gusty easterly/northeasterly winds possible late Saturday–Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected in Delaware Bay/Delaware River.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered showers possible this weekend; widespread heavy rainfall not anticipated.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Long-period swells and enhanced rip currents along the New Jersey and Delaware coasts could affect pilotage and small craft operations.
